page.title: 20HISTORY OF ARMADALE TO 1906
page.content: THE 13C SAW THIS AREA AS THICKLY COVERED WOODLAND IN WHICH DEER AND WILD BOAR WERE HUNTED BY ROYALTY. { "FRAE BOG BURN TO BOAR BOUGHLEE,ANE {CAT COULD LOUP FRAE TREE TO TREE,"}A POET WROTE.WHEN THE GREAT ROAD FROM { EDINBURGH TO GLASGOW WAS BUILT IN 1786 A{TOLL HOUSE}WAS ERECTED AT THE CROSS. HERE DAIRY PRODUCTS WERE SOLD AND TRAVELLERS & VILLAGERS EXCHANGED NEWS. THE CARRON IRON WORKS COMPANY BEGAN OPERATING{MINES}TO THE NORTH AND THE POPULATION OF THE VILLAGE GREW. UNTIL 1863 WHEN ARMADALE WAS MADE A BURGH, {WATER}WAS OBTAINED FROM 2 WELLS AT THE BURN. THE MAIN{FUEL}WAS PARAFFIN UNTIL 1865. GAS WAS THEN HELD IN HUGE TANKS. A THATCHED COTTAGE WAS RENTED IN 1819 AS A{SCHOOL.}BY 1857 FUNDS WERE RAISED TO BUILD A SUBSCRIPTION SCHOOL.AFTER THE 1870 EDUCATION ACT AN INFANT TO JUNIOR SECONDARY SCHOOL BEGAN.
